Trade/Device Name(s): BD Phoenix Automated Microbiology System Erythromycin (0.0625-8 μg/mL)
BD Phoenix Automated Microbiology System Quinupristin/dalfopristin (0.25-4 μg/mL)
BD Phoenix Automated Microbiology System Chloramphenicol (1-32 μg/mL)
Regulation Name(s): Fully Automated Short-Term Incubation Cycle Antimicrobial Susceptibility Devices
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for BD Phoenix Automated Microbiology System with Erythromycin, Quinupristin/dalfopristin, and Chloramphenicol for automated susceptibility testing of aerobic and facultative anaerobic bacteria from pure cultures
Indications for Use Summary: Intended for in vitro quantitative determination of antimicrobial susceptibility by minimal inhibitory concentration (MIC) of most Gram-negative aerobic and facultative anaerobic bacteria isolates for Enterobacteriaceae, Non-Enterobacteriaceae, and most Gram-positive bacteria isolates belonging to Staphylococcus, Enterococcus, and Streptococcus from pure culture
